hint: The closest planet to the Sun.
A system of millions or billions of stars, together with gas and dust, held together by gravitational attraction.
A celestial body that orbits a planet; a category of which the Moon is an example.
A large, glowing ball of gas that generates heat and light through nuclear fusion.
The fifth planet from the Sun and the largest in our solar system.
A small icy body that, when passing close to the sun, warms and begins to release gases, a process called outgassing.
A group of stars forming a recognizable pattern that is traditionally named after its apparent form or identified with a mythological figure.
The second-largest planet in our solar system, known for its prominent ring system.
